coredata.dc:title: Asymmetric clustering using the alpha-beta divergence

abstract.ce:para: We propose the use of an asymmetric dissimilarity measure in centroid-based clustering. The dissimilarity employed is the Alpha-Beta divergence (AB-divergence), which can be asymmetrized using its parameters. We compute the degree of asymmetry of the AB-divergence on the basis of the within-cluster variances. In this way, the proposed approach is able to flexibly model even clusters with significantly different variances. Consequently, this method overcomes one of the major drawbacks of the standard symmetric centroid-based clustering. © 2013 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

xocs:funding.xocs:funding-agency: Javna Agencija za Raziskovalno Dejavnost RS

xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: This work is a part of the programme Synergetics of Complex Systems and Processes no. P2-0241, funded by the Slovenian Research Agency. Furthermore, the authors wish to thank the reviewers for their helpful comments. Dominik Olszewski was born in Warsaw, Poland. He received his M.Sc. degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the Warsaw University of Technology, in 2007, and a Ph.D. degree in Automation and Robotics also from the Warsaw University of Technology, Poland, in 2012. He holds a position of assistant professor at the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Warsaw University of Technology. His research fields include clustering, classification, feature extraction, and feature selection. Branko Šter was born in Maribor, Slovenia. He is an associate professor at the Faculty of Computer and Information Science, University of Ljubljana. He holds a B.Sc. and a M.Sc. degree in Electrical Engineering from University of Ljubljana, 1993 and 1996, respectively, and a Ph.D. degree in Computer and Information Science from University of Ljubljana, 1999. His research fields include neural networks, pattern recognition, and reinforcement learning.

item-info.copyright: Copyright 2014 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

abstract.ce:para: We propose the use of an asymmetric dissimilarity measure in centroid-based clustering. The dissimilarity employed is the Alpha-Beta divergence (AB-divergence), which can be asymmetrized using its parameters. We compute the degree of asymmetry of the AB-divergence on the basis of the within-cluster variances. In this way, the proposed approach is able to flexibly model even clusters with significantly different variances. Consequently, this method overcomes one of the major drawbacks of the standard symmetric centroid-based clustering. © 2013 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
